abstract: Heavy out-of-season winter storm slams into Colorado and southeast Wyoming, delivering total of 12 to 14 inches in some communities near Denver, and even more in higher peaks and passes of the Rockies.
snippet: The storm, which is expected to dump upward of 12 to 14 inches in some parts of the state, delivered more snow than the Denver area typically gets in all of October.
lead_paragraph: The storm, which is expected to dump upward of 12 to 14 inches in some parts of the state, delivered more snow than the Denver area typically gets in all of October.

headline.main: Early Snow Turns Colorado’s Fall Foliage to Winter White
headline.print_headline: Early Snow Turns Colorado’s Fall Foliage to Winter White
headline.seo: Colorado Slammed by Early Snow Storm
